title: Elderly woman reduces knee pain naturally with one major dietary change - Watch video - India.com
summary:
Elderly Woman Eases Knee Pain with Dietary Changes

Publication Date: January 2, 2025
Source: India.com

Knee pain affects many elderly individuals, especially during winter months. An elderly woman shared how she alleviated her pain through dietary changes, specifically increasing her protein intake.

  • Knee pain is a widespread issue among the elderly, often exacerbated in winter.
  • The woman made significant dietary changes by increasing protein consumption.
  • Dr. Sayajirao Gaikwad highlighted the benefits of a rich protein diet, including eggs, paneer, meat, and legumes.
  • She improved her condition significantly, avoiding knee replacement surgery and ensuring better quality of life.
This is how I encourage elderly people to eat high protein foods. With just putting them on high protein foods we see change in quality of their life. Our elder deserve nutrient dense foods. Eggs, paneer, meat, legumes rich diet. Strictly lowering rice, stopping wheat helping her. — Dr. Sayajirao Gaikwad

This case highlights the potential for dietary adjustments to improve health outcomes for elderly individuals, showcasing the importance of nutrition in managing discomfort.
newTitle: Elderly Woman Eases Knee Pain with Dietary Changes

  • Healthy eating patterns lead to overall better health.

title: Bhopal gas tragedy: Toxic waste removed from Union carbide factory after 40 years - BBC.com
summary:
Bhopal gas tragedy: Toxic waste removed from Union carbide factory after 40 years

Publication Date: Not specified
Source: BBC News

Authorities in India have successfully removed hundreds of tonnes of toxic waste from the site of the 1984 Bhopal gas tragedy, where thousands died from a gas leak. The removal follows a court order aimed at addressing the long-standing environmental and health hazards posed by the waste.

  • 337 tonnes of toxic waste transported to an incinerator 230 km away.
  • The waste removal comes 40 years after the gas leak incident that killed thousands.
  • Activists express concern over the health risks of incinerating the waste at the new location.
  • Groundwater near the factory remains contaminated, affecting residential areas.
  • Previous attempts to dispose of the waste faced significant opposition and were abandoned.
  • The Bhopal gas tragedy is recognized as one of the largest industrial disasters globally.
“The 1.1 million tonnes of toxic soil and waste still continues to contaminate the groundwater of hundreds and thousands of people [in Bhopal],” said Rachna Dhingra from the International Campaign for Justice in Bhopal.

The recent waste removal is a critical step but highlights the ongoing challenges related to environmental justice and health for Bhopal’s residents.
newTitle: Bhopal Gas Tragedy: Toxic Waste Cleared After 40 Years

summary:
Rohit Sharma Dropped for SCG Test Against Australia

Date: Friday
Source: Times of India

Rohit Sharma has been dropped from the Indian cricket team for the Sydney Test against Australia due to his poor recent form.

  • Rohit returned to lead the team after missing the first Test due to the birth of his second child.
  • His return saw changes in batting order that did not yield positive results.
  • Rohit has scored only 31 runs in five innings during the ongoing Border-Gavaskar Trophy.
  • His overall performance in 2024 has been disappointing, with a meager average of 24.76.
  • Jasprit Bumrah is expected to lead the team in this final match of the series.
“Rohit has mustered just 31 runs from five innings at an average of 6.20.”

title: M&M, Tata Motors bag big PLI incentives; earn brownie points for their work in advanced auto tech - The Economic Times
How change in diet eased elderly woman's knee pain; doctor shares heartwarming video - The Times of India
summary:
How Change in Diet Eased Elderly Woman's Knee Pain

Publication Date: Not provided Source: Not provided

In a heartwarming post, Dr. Sayajirao Gaikwad shares how dietary changes significantly improved an elderly woman's quality of life by alleviating her knee pain.

  • Protein is crucial for the elderly to combat sarcopenia, which leads to muscle loss.
  • The woman in the video, initially advised for knee replacement, experienced a 75% reduction in pain after modifying her diet.
  • Dr. Gaikwad emphasizes incorporating protein-rich foods like eggs, paneer, meat, and legumes while minimizing rice and wheat.
  • Important protein sources include lentils, chickpeas, and dairy products like Greek yogurt.
“With just putting them on high protein foods we see change in quality of their life. Our elder deserve nutrient dense foods.” — Dr. Sayajirao Gaikwad

This article highlights the importance of dietary adjustments for the elderly, showcasing how a focus on protein can lead to substantial health improvements.
newTitle: How Change in Diet Eased Elderly Woman's Knee Pain

Nitish's Cryptic Response to Lalu's Offer Regarding INDIA Bloc

Published on: January 02, 2025 03:31 pm IST | Source: The Hindu

Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar responded cryptically to RJD president Lalu Prasad's recent offer to join the INDIA bloc. Amidst political speculations, Kumar's dismissive reply has sparked discussions on the future of alliances in Bihar.

  • Nitish Kumar's response to Lalu's offer was simply, "Kya bol rahe hain" (What are you saying).
  • Tejashwi Yadav attempted to downplay Lalu's remarks, suggesting they were aimed at media curiosity.
  • Lalu Prasad stated, "Our doors are open (for Nitish). He should also unbolt his gates."
  • The context of this exchange includes the backdrop of upcoming Assembly polls.
  • Union Minister Rajiv Ranjan Singh asserted the NDA's strength, downplaying Lalu's comments.
“What would he do if people like you keep coming to him with the same question?” - Tejashwi Yadav

This exchange highlights the ongoing political maneuvering in Bihar as parties prepare for future elections, reflecting shifting alliances and public sentiment.

title: Oversleeping: Too Much Sleep Can Be Bad For Your Health, Heres how - NDTV Doctor
summary:
Oversleeping: Too Much Sleep Can Be Bad For Your Health, Here's how

Date: Jan 2, 2025 Source: DoctorNDTV

Oversleeping can significantly affect your physical and mental health, increasing risks for serious conditions.

  • Oversleeping is linked to cardiovascular disease, diabetes, and headaches.
  • It can cause mental health issues such as depression and anxiety.
  • Sleeping too much may lead to weight gain by affecting diet and physical activity patterns.
  • The recommended sleep duration for adults is 7-9 hours, depending on individual factors.
  • Seeking professional help is advised if oversleeping is frequent.
“Having enough, quality sleep is crucial for your mental and physical health.”

In summary, while sleep is essential, oversleeping can lead to adverse health effects. Balance and moderation are key for overall well-being.
newTitle: Oversleeping: Risks and Recommendations for Better Sleep Health

India’s Test captain Rohit Sharma has decided to rest for the final Test of the Border-Gavaskar Trophy against Australia, with Jasprit Bumrah stepping in as captain.

  • Rohit informed coach Gautam Gambhir and chairman of selectors Ajit Agarkar of his decision to opt-out.
  • Shubman Gill will replace Rohit in the playing XI, batting at number three.

title: Manu Bhaker, Gukesh among four athletes to get Khel Ratna award - The Hindu
summary:
Manu Bhaker, Gukesh among four athletes to get Khel Ratna award

Date: January 02, 2025 Source: The Hindu

The quartet of shooter Manu Bhaker, World Chess Champion D. Gukesh, men's hockey captain Harmanpreet Singh, and para-athlete Praveen Kumar were named recipients of this year's Major Dhyan Chand Khel Ratna Award — the country's highest sporting honour.

  • Manu Bhaker won two medals in the recent Olympics, becoming the first athlete from independent India to achieve this.
  • D. Gukesh became the youngest World Chess Champion and contributed to India's gold in the Chess Olympiad.
  • Harmanpreet Singh led the Indian men's hockey team to a bronze medal in the Olympics.
  • Praveen Kumar was crowned the T64 champion in the Paris Paralympics.
“The awardees will receive their awards from the President of India at a specially organised function at Rashtrapati Bhavan on 17th January, 2025 [Friday] at 1100 hours,” the Sports Ministry said.

This recognition highlights the excellence and achievements of these athletes in their respective sports, showcasing India's emerging sporting talent.
newTitle: Manu Bhaker, Gukesh Among Four Athletes Receivers of Khel Ratna Award

Publication Date: December 24, 2024 | Source: NDTV

Double Olympic medallist shooter Manu Bhaker and chess world champion D Gukesh have been awarded the prestigious Dhyan Chand Khel Ratna award by the Sports Ministry, alongside Harmanpreet Singh and Praveen Kumar. The Khel Ratna is the highest sporting honour in India.

  • Manu Bhaker has recently dealt with controversy regarding her nomination, previously causing frustration among her supporters.
  • Bhaker is the first athlete from independent India to win two medals in a single edition of the Olympics.
  • D Gukesh, 18, became the youngest World champion and contributed to India’s historic gold in the Chess Olympiad.
  • Praveen Kumar, para high-jumper, clinched a T64 championship at the Paris Paralympics.
  • Awards will be presented by the President of India on January 17, 2025.
“With regards to ongoing issue for my nomination for the most prestigious Khel Ratna award - my role is to play and perform for my country. Awards keep me motivated but are not my goal.” - Manu Bhaker

This recognition highlights the achievements of athletes who excel despite challenges, fostering motivation among future sportspeople.
newTitle: Manu Bhaker and D Gukesh Among Four Athletes Honored with Khel Ratna Award

title: What’s Switzerland’s ‘Anti-Burqa’ Law That Comes Into Effect From January 1? | Explained - News18
summary:
What’s Switzerland’s ‘Anti-Burqa’ Law That Comes Into Effect From January 1? | Explained

Date: January 02, 2025

Source: News18

From January 1, 2025, Switzerland officially bans burqas, hijabs, and any other face coverings in public spaces, as mandated by a law solidified in 2023 after a 2021 referendum where 51.2% of voters supported the ban.

  • The law includes fines of up to 1,000 francs for violators.
  • Exceptions are made for health-related facial coverings and coverings in places of worship.
  • The proposal was driven by the right-wing Swiss People's Party, citing concerns over extremism.
  • The Muslim population in Switzerland is predominantly from Turkey, Bosnia, and Kosovo, making up about 5% of the total population.
“Today’s decision opens old wounds, further expands the principle of legal inequality, and sends a clear signal of exclusion to the Muslim minority.” - Central Council of Muslims

This law raises significant discussions on women's rights, identity, and the ongoing debate surrounding secularism and multiculturalism in Switzerland.
newTitle: Switzerland's Anti-Burqa Law Explained: What You Need to Know

title: Agra murders: Accused sedated 4 sisters, mother; used scarf, sharp object for crime - Hindustan Times
summary:
Agra murders: Accused sedated 4 sisters, mother; used scarf, sharp object for crime

Date: Jan 02, 2025
Source: Hindustan Times

The shocking incident in Agra saw a young man sedate his four sisters and mother before murdering them. This gruesome crime highlights deep family issues and alleged harassment from neighbors.

  • The murderer, Mohd Arshad, is 24 years old and allegedly confessed to the crime.
  • The victims include four sisters aged 9, 16, 18, and 19, and their mother.
  • The police suspect the victims were sedated as there were no signs of struggle.
  • Arshad claims he acted out of fear of harassment from neighbors.
  • The crime took place in a hotel room in Lucknow.
"He was afraid that if something happened to him, what would happen to his mother and sisters." - DCP Raveena Tyagi

This tragic event raises serious questions about family dynamics and community safety, emphasizing the need for support systems for vulnerable families.
newTitle: Agra Murders: Brother Sedates and Kills Four Sisters and Mother

title: Dallewal fast: SC blames Punjab officials, some farmer leaders for false impression on breaking fast - The Hindu
summary:
Supreme Court Criticizes Punjab Officials and Farmer Leaders Over Dallewal's Hunger Strike

Publication Date: January 02, 2025 Source: The Hindu

The Supreme Court has pointed out the misleading portrayals by Punjab officials and certain farmer leaders regarding the ongoing hunger strike of farmer leader Jagjit Singh Dallewal. The court emphasized that the efforts to hospitalize Dallewal should not be seen as an attempt to end his protest.

  • Justice Surya Kant criticized both Punjab officials and farmers' leaders for creating a false narrative in the media.
  • Justice Ujjal Bhuyyan questioned the Centre's reluctance to address the grievances of the protesting farmers.
  • The health of Dallewal is increasingly precarious as he continues his fast, which has lasted over 35 days.
  • Justice Kant stated that hospitalizing Dallewal does not mean he must end his fast.
  • The farmers are advocating for a law that guarantees minimum pricing for their crops to protect their interests.
  • A court-appointed committee is set to meet with farmers virtually on January 3.
“This issue is becoming more and more sensitive, and time is passing,” Justice Kant observed.

Justice Kant described Dallewal as a “precious leader” dedicated to the farmers' cause and expressed concerns over the Punjab government’s lack of conciliatory measures.
newTitle: Supreme Court Criticizes Punjab Officials and Farmer Leaders Over Dallewal's Hunger Strike
